company_context: PostgreSQL: The world's most advanced open source database February 16, 2026: Out-of-cycle release scheduled for February 26, 2026 PostgreSQL: The World's Most Advanced Open Source Relational Database Download New to PostgreSQL? New to PostgreSQL? PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 35 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance. There is a wealth of information to be found describing how to install and use PostgreSQL through the official documentation . The open source community provides many helpful places to become familiar with PostgreSQL, discover how it works, and find career opportunities. Learn more on how to engage with the community . Learn More Feature Matrix Governance Latest Releases 2026-02-12 - PostgreSQL 18.2, 17.8, 16.12, 15.16, and 14.21 Released! The PostgreSQL Global Development Group has released an update to all supported versions of PostgreSQL, including 18.2, 17.8, 16.12, 15.16, and 14.21. This release fixes 5 security vulnerabilities and over 65 bugs reported over the last several months. You can find details on the fixes in the release notes . For the more information about this release, please review the release notes . You can download PostgreSQL from the download page. For more information on PostgreSQL 18, the latest major version of PostgreSQL, please see the full press release and translations of the release announcement in the press kit . 18.2 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 17.8 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 16.12 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 15.16 · 2026-02-12 · Notes 14.21 · 2026-02-12 · Notes Download Why Upgrade? Security Upcoming Events 2026-03-05 – 2026-03-06 · PostgreSQL@SCaLE23x 2026-03-10 · FOSSASIA PGDay 2026 2026-03-11 – 2026-03-13 · PGConf India 2026 2026-03-19 · PG BootCamp Russia 2026 2026-03-26 · pgDay Paris 2026 2026-04-21 – 2026-04-22 · PostgreSQL Conference Germany 2026 2026-04-26 – 2026-04-28 · HOW2026: PostgreSQL & IvorySQL Ecosystem Conference indicates that an event is recognised under the community event guidelines and is directly helping the PostgreSQL community. Check Schedule Add Your Event Mailing Lists The PostgreSQL mailing lists enable you to interact with active community participants on subjects related to the development of PostgreSQL, discovering how to use PostgreSQL, or learning about upcoming events and product releases. In order to manage your mailing list subscription, you need a PostgreSQL community account . Signing up is easy and gives you direct access to the global PostgreSQL community . Subscribe View Archives Learning Opportunities Ahead Want to learn more about PostgreSQL and help build the community? Come to one of the many events, local user groups, & training sessions where you can meet experienced PostgreSQL users and enhance your database skills. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their database performance and unlock new insights from their data. I came across your company and noticed you're using PostgreSQL. Can you tell me a bit about your current database setup and any challenges you're facing?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (sighs) Ah, another sales call. Look, we're happy with PostgreSQL. It's open source, reliable, and meets our needs. I'm not sure what kind of "optimization" you're offering, but I'm skeptical. What makes you think we need something like DeepData AI?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your skepticism, and I appreciate your honesty. However, many of our customers who use PostgreSQL have seen significant improvements in query performance and data processing times with DeepData AI. Our solution uses AI-powered algorithms to analyze and optimize database workloads, which can lead to cost savings and improved overall system efficiency. I'd love to discuss some specific use cases and see if there's a potential fit for your company. Can you tell me more about your current database workloads and any pain points you're experiencing?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (pauses) Okay, fine. We do have some issues with query performance, especially during peak hours. But we've been addressing those with indexing and caching. I'm not sure if we need a third-party solution to fix what we can handle in-house. Plus, I'm concerned about the potential overhead and complexity of integrating another tool into our stack.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand your concerns about complexity and overhead. However, DeepData AI is designed to be a lightweight and non-intrusive solution that can be easily integrated with your existing PostgreSQL setup. We've worked with many companies who have similar concerns, and our solution has proven to be a seamless addition to their tech stack. Regarding the query performance issues, I'd like to ask: have you considered the potential benefits of predictive analytics and automated optimization? Our solution can help you identify and address performance issues before they become critical, which can lead to significant cost savings and improved system reliability.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (thoughtfully) I suppose that sounds interesting. But what kind of ROI can we expect from implementing DeepData AI? And what's the typical implementation timeline for a company of our size? We're a relatively small team, and I don't want to take on a project that's going to distract us from our core business.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Great questions. Our typical implementation timeline is around 6-8 weeks, depending on the complexity of the setup and the level of integration required. As for ROI, our customers have seen an average of 30-40% reduction in database costs and a 25-30% improvement in query performance. I'd be happy to provide some case studies and references from similar companies who have implemented DeepData AI. Would you be open to a follow-up conversation to discuss the details further and explore whether our solution is a good fit for your company?
